channel.title: Port forwarding help [linksys e1200] will rep++
channel.description: I have followed all linksys port forwarding guides and have tried everything, using no-ip for client. I need help I dont know why I have never been able to get port forwarding to work if anybody could help i would greatly appreciate it i will rep ++ i would prefer help by teamviewer but just a quick guide that works for me will work thanks in advance.

item.description:
@deadlyhorror wrote:

Yo ill help u portforward and we will get it, message me or something

Read full topic
item.source: Port forwarding help [linksys e1200] will rep++

item.title: Port forwarding help [linksys e1200] will rep++
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

  1. Click start and hit run, enter cmd and press ok.

  2. type in ipconfig and press enter.

  3. Look for the LAN connection, and remember ‘default gateway’ and ‘IP Address’, Remember those for later.

  4. Open up your web browser and enter the ‘default gateway’.

  5. You will be prompted with a user and password input. Put ‘password’ as the password and click ok.

  6. Upon entering your routers web panel you will see a list of tabs at the top, browse to ‘Applications and Gaming’.

7.You will see a port forwarding table. This is what you put in

External Port: [your servers port] ( 49534, 5555 )
Internal Port: [your servers port] ( 49534, 5555 )
Protocal: leave this on 'both'
To IP Address: put 'IP Address'
Enabled: Make sure its check marked
  1. Click ‘Save Settings’ at the bottom

Read full topic
item.source: Port forwarding help [linksys e1200] will rep++
